quest.name: Helping a Friend
journal: Sagar is concerned for a friend.

Sagar tells you of Berehta, a kind and caring woman of Coldhearth who seems oddly troubled of late. She refuses to speak with anyone, but she has always been fond of travelers. He asks you to speak with her in the hopes of getting her to open up.

Berehta has been thinking about her son, Erart, a young man of twenty summers who fled the village to avoid conscription by the Garleans. With the threat of the imperials gone, however, she is hoping he will someday return. Daunted by the dangers of the world outside Coldhearth, she asks you to inquire after him in her stead. She suggests stopping in Radiata, where he likely passed through on his escape to freedom.

You speak with the people of Radiata, and while most cannot recall meeting a man named Erart, the trail is not yet cold. One villager is fairly certain a man by the name Godafre will know who you are looking for.

Godafre indeed knows Erart. In fact, he helped hide him from the soldiers who came to Radiata in pursuit of him. Godafre goes on to say he and an acquaintance smuggled him north past Specula Imperatoris, but he knows not what happened next. With no other information to be had, you return to Coldhearth to let Berehta know her son seems to have fled to safety.
Relief is clear on Berehta's face when you relay to her what you learned of Erart. Though she is gladdened to hear he is safe, she cannot deny that she misses him.

dialogue.name: SAGAR
dialogue.text: Excuse me, misssir. Mind lendin' me a hand with somethin'?

dialogue.name: SAGAR
dialogue.text: A friend of mine, Berehta's her name, she seems troubled these days. She's a sweet woman, and I'd like to help her, but she won't talk to anyone. She's always been fond of travelers passin' through, so I figure she might open up a bit to you.

dialogue.name: SAGAR
dialogue.text: I wonder what's troublin' her. I hope it's nothin' serious.

dialogue.name: BEREHTA
dialogue.text: You're that adventurin' lasslad Raubahn came here with, aren't you? Well I'll be! What can I do for you?

dialogue.name: BEREHTA
dialogue.text: Sagar's worried about me, is he? That's kind of him, but my troubles are nothin' he can help with. Might be a strappin' young lasslad like yourself could, though.

dialogue.name: BEREHTA
dialogue.text: I've been meanin' to find my son. A fine young lad, goin' on twenty now.

dialogue.name: BEREHTA
dialogue.text: The Garleans what came through here conscripted all our young men, but by the grace of Rhalgr he gave them the slip. Trouble is, though, my boy never came home...

dialogue.name: BEREHTA
dialogue.text: The Garleans have long since fled these parts, so I'm hopin' he'll come back.

dialogue.name: BEREHTA
dialogue.text: I'd go and search for him myself, but I've never left Coldhearth before. I'm not like to get too far on my own. Might you be willing to take a look around for me?

dialogue.name: BEREHTA
dialogue.text: Bless you, child. I can't imagine where he ran off to, but there's a good chance he passed through Radiata to the north.

dialogue.name: BEREHTA
dialogue.text: This is only what I've heard from the merchants who come through, mind you, but there's Garlean outposts all over. If he was lookin' for a place to lay low before movin' on, it'd have to be there.

dialogue.name: BEREHTA
dialogue.text: His name's Erart, by the way. He's got blond hair, and an old scar across one cheek. You'll know him when you see him.

dialogue.name: BEREHTA
dialogue.text: I doubt he's been stayin' in Radiata all this time, but I'm sure someone there's at least seen him.

dialogue.name: SAGAR
dialogue.text: She's asked you to find Erart? Gods, I hope you find the boy. I haven't seen him in years.

dialogue.name: MAWT
dialogue.text: Erart? Sorry, misssir, can't say I know anyone by that name.

dialogue.name: HRUODIGER
dialogue.text: Erart... Erart... Where have I heard that name before? Yes, of course! Wait, no...no I can't say I know an Erart.

dialogue.name: GARRULOUSGALL
dialogue.text: Erart? Hmmm. I'm certain Godafre has mentioned him before. You might have better luck speaking with him.

dialogue.name: MAWT
dialogue.text: Sorry, friend, but I don't know anyone by the name of Erart.

dialogue.name: HRUODIGER
dialogue.text: I'm sure it'll come to me. Erart, was it? If I can remember anything, you'll be the first to know.

dialogue.name: GARRULOUSGALL
dialogue.text: I can't say I know anyone by that name, but I'm sure Godafre knows who you're looking for.

dialogue.name: GODAFRE
dialogue.text: Erart? Sure, I know him. Been a long time since he's been around here, though.

dialogue.name: GODAFRE
dialogue.text: He showed up about two years ago, escaping from the Garleans. I couldn't stand the thought of them dragging him away like they did my son, so I helped keep him out of sight. Thinking back on it now, that was quite the gamble.

dialogue.name: GODAFRE
dialogue.text: Of course, it would've only been a matter of time before they caught on. I had a friend of mine, Stark Woad, help him make his escape.

dialogue.name: GODAFRE
dialogue.text: She snuck him out with a shipment of provisions. If memory serves, she made a stop at Specula Imperatoris, but I don't know where they went after that.

dialogue.name: GODAFRE
dialogue.text: Not sure if that helps you any, but I'm afraid that's all I know. Best of luck to you.

dialogue.name: GODAFRE
dialogue.text: If anyone could see him safely past Specula Imperatoris, it's Stark Woad. I'm sure he's safe.

dialogue.name: BEREHTA
dialogue.text: Back already. Did you find out anything about my boy? Is he safe?

dialogue.name: BEREHTA
dialogue.text: Passed through the Garlean outpost to the north? So he escaped, then...

dialogue.name: BEREHTA
dialogue.text: It does my heart good to know he's out of harm's way. <sigh> I sure do miss him...
